cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles south of Miami, Florida – making landfall along the south-central coast of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest later Sunday, pass through the Florida Straits and near or over the Florida Keys tonight, then drift westward into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys (near or over the islands)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from Deerfield Beach to Bonita Beach including the Florida Keys (hurricane) and Golden Beach to Bonita Beach including Biscayne Bay (storm-surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from the Brevard/Volusia County line southward around the peninsula to Englewood, including Florida Bay, the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and south-central Florida coastline, including Miami-Dade, Broward (Port Everglades), Palm Beach counties, the Keys and Biscayne Bay
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical storm-force winds (34–50 kt) with higher gusts possible Sunday night into Monday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation above ground possible along the southeast Florida coast and in Biscayne Bay, including Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches widespread with isolated 18-inch totals; significant flash and urban flooding likely in the Fort Lauderdale/Broward County area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes during outer rain bands.
